page.title: 01Principal Features
page.content: The area is sparsely populated overall.The main A10 Trunk Road ( formerly Ermine St. - an old Roman Road ),connecting London and Cambridge,runs through the western edge of the block.The River Rib meanders its way towards the Lea Valley through the eastern part of the block.Most of the land is farmed - arable crops mainly.An independant school - St. Edmund's College - is in the NW corner of the block.The main settlement is Colliers End , a linear development on the A10.There are two small villages - Barwick and Latchford - connected to the A10 by a minor road,whose inhabitants are either involved in farming or local industry. These villages provide some of the essential services for the community like the church,butcher,pub and garage.
